choices.text:
what is a Hendiadys?
Hendiadys is a rhetorical device in which two words or phrases are joined together with the conjunction "and" to express a single idea, often for emphasis or to create a more concise and powerful statement. It is also known as a "coupled expression." For example, instead of saying "I am going to go and buy some groceries," one might use hendiadys and say "I am going to buy groceries and nothing else."
